wikipedia_page.main: Andrew Hunt (1791–1861) was a British landscapist and teacher of drawing.

response: Alfred William Hunt  (15 November 1830 – 3 May 1896), was a British painter. He was son of the landscapist Andrew Hunt.
* date unknown – Andrew Hunt, English landscape painter (born 1790)
Andy or Andrew Hunt may refer to:
*Andrew Hunt (historian) (born 1968), history professor at the University of Waterloo

Lines' pupils included Thomas Creswick, Andrew Hunt, William Wyon and his own sons Samuel Rostill Lines, Frederick Thomas Lines and Henry Harris Lines. His art classes notoriously started at five o'clock in the morning, with Lines himself personally visiting latecomers to rouse them.

Macgregor first learned drawing at the drawing academy in Liverpool run by her grandfather Andrew Hunt. Her parents went to live in London and she began to study painting there, becoming a pupil at the Schools of the Royal Academy where her teachers were Lord Leighton, P. H. Calderon, R.A., and John Pettie, R.A.Women in the fine arts, from the Seventh Century B.C. to the Twentieth Century A.D., by Clara Erskine Clement, 1904
